meanings.definition: To produce saliva in the mouth in anticipation of food
meanings.sent1: The dog salivates when it sees a juicy bone.
meanings.sent2: She always salivates before a delicious meal.
meanings.sent3: The thought of pizza makes him salivate uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of freshly baked cookies made her salivate like a waterfall.
meanings.sent5: As the chef prepared the dish, the audience could almost hear them salivate.

meanings.definition: To show great interest or desire in something
meanings.sent1: He salivates over the latest tech gadgets.
meanings.sent2: The kids salivate at the sight of the colorful candies.
meanings.sent3: She salivates over fashion magazines, dreaming of new outfits.
meanings.sent4: The team salivated at the opportunity to compete in the championship.
meanings.sent5: The artist salivated over the idea of creating a masterpiece.
